Provider: Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Hospital

Public Notes:
(Last updated Apr 3)
**Northern/Southern California:**
- People 50 years and older are eligible for vaccine
- Starting April 15 — people 16 years and older are eligible for vaccine
- Appointment availability is dependent on supply — We’ve increased our capacity to deliver more vaccine doses at our own facilities as well as in multiple mass vaccination hubs across the state. Our ability to accommodate all who will now be eligible is dependent on our receiving enough vaccine supply. 
- Scheduling appointments — We aren’t able to preschedule appointments for newly eligible individuals in advance of April 15.
- [More details here](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/health-wellness/coronavirus-information/covid-vaccine).

Provider: Blue Cross Blue Shield of CA
Public Notes: Apr 2: Blue Cross recommends that their members consult this list of vaccination clinic options: https://www.blueshieldca.com/bsca/bsc/wcm/connect/sites/sites\_content\_en/coronavirus/vaccine-locations

Cottage Health is offering COVID-19 vaccine at multiple locations based on available vaccine supply. 
Appointments are required. Everyone age 16+ is now eligible to receive vaccine. Minors age 16 or 17 may receive only Pfizer vaccine and must be accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Mar 30: _One Medical anticipates that it will administer vaccines to eligible members of the general public at select locations in California soon. Once available, individuals will be able to use_ _[MyTurn](http://myturn.ca.gov/) to book a vaccine appointment at a designated One Medical location or elsewhere._ Updates can be found online at https://www.onemedical.com/blog/live-well/updates-covid-19-vaccinations-efforts-your-area

Apr 2: UCSF is currently vaccinating:
- Adults age 50 and over, or age 16-64 with co-morbidities
- Workers in education, formal or informal childcare, libraries, foster care or children’s residential care facilities
- Workers in food & agriculture, transportation, utilities or disaster services
- Documented direct caregivers
- Individuals who are unhoused or live in a high-risk congregate setting
- Second doses for those who received their first dose at a UCSF vaccination site

Further information and appointment booking instructions for eligible patients can be found online at: <https://coronavirus.ucsf.edu/vaccines>
Apr 2: Walgreens appointments can be made online at https://www.walgreens.com/findcare/vaccination/covid-19
Apr 2: Walmart is now offering COVID-19 vaccines in California. You can find the latest information about Walmart's COVID-19 vaccination program at https://corporate.walmart.com/covid-vaccine
Apr 2: Sam's Club is now offering COVID-19 vaccines in California.  For more info, go to https://www.samsclub.com/pharmacy/immunization?imzType=covid

Apr 1: Currently vaccinating:
- Health care workers
- Patients who are aged 50 or older
- Individuals who are aged 18-64 with [severe health conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Provider-Bulletin-2-12-21.aspx)
- Individuals who work or reside in high-risk congregate settings
- Persons experiencing homelessness who may move to congregate settings at short notice
- Emergency services workers
- Food or agriculture workers
- Education or childcare workers (includes staff and any other workers involved in child and/or student care)
- Public transit, airports, and commercial airlines workers

Appointments can be booked online or by phone. Details are available at https://stanfordhealthcare.org/discover/covid-19-resource-center/patient-care/safety-health-vaccine-planning.html?

Apr 2: Limited quantities available at select locations

_Note: Patients who received their first dose of COVID vaccine from Ralphs will be assigned a second dose appointment._
